item.title: About
item.description: This blog is contributed to ARM and iOS exploitation, debugging and testing.

item.title: 0x04 ROP gadgets
item.description: Gagdets ROP gadget is a small sequence of assembly instructions that end in a return instruction.

item.title: 0x03 Return Oriented Programming
item.description: Assembler Assembly language is based on registers, that can store data or addresses, and each assembly instruction manipulate these registers in some way.

item.title: ASCII codes
item.description: [common ascii codes to know] Char Dec Oct Hex WhatAreThey --------------------------------------- (nul) 0 0000 0x00 Null (ht) 9 0011 0x09 Horizontal Tab (nl) 10 0012 0x0a New Line (vt) 11 0013 0x0b Vertical Tab (cr) 13 0015 0x0d Carriage Return (sp) 32 0040 0x20 Space 0 48 0060 0x30 zero A 65 0101 0x41 capital A a 97 0141 0x61 lowercase a [ascii table] Char Dec Oct Hex | Char Dec Oct Hex | Char Dec Oct Hex | Char Dec Oct Hex ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- (nul) 0 0000 0x00 | (sp) 32 0040 0x20 | @ 64 0100 0x40 | ` 96 0140 0x60 (soh) 1 0001 0x01 | !

item.title: 0x02 Exploiting buffer overflow vulnerability
item.description: In this example we will disassemble our binary app code in search for hidden function, then we will exploit buffer overflow vulnerability to take advantage of changing our app execution flow.

item.title: 0x01 Hello Buffer Overflow
item.description: Firstly let’s connect to the device, write some simple (vulnerable) C code, compile and run it leading to buffer overflow.

item.title: Init
item.description: Project objective Main goal of this project is to learn some ARM platfrom exploiting basics, which will further lead to develop some skills in exploiting methods targeted to Apple’s devices.
